newsitem.title: UK: Shell sees oil/gas output rising 7 pct/year.
newsitem.headline: Shell sees oil/gas output rising 7 pct/year.

text.p: Royal Dutch/Shell Group's global crude oil and natural gas production was expected to grow by seven percent a year between now and the year 2001, Shell Chairman John Jennings said on Thursday.
Jennings told reporters at a briefing following the announcement of the company's annual results that Shell had succeeded in reversing a downward trend in the company's oil and gas reserves.
Jennings said Shell was "predicting stronger growth in gas and crude production...of a seven percent annual increase between now and 2001."
Shell earlier said 1996 crude oil production was 2.3 million barrels per day (bpd), up two percent from 1995, and natural gas volume rose 10 percent to 8.4 billion cubic feet per day.
Total oil products sales rose by six percent in 1996 to 6.3 million bpd, it said.
Jennings said Shell had been able to increase its oil and gas reserves last year, but would not give any details.
"We have succeeding in reversing the downward trend in oil and gas reserves," he said.
